name: etatist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
supporting or having a policy of complete control by the state (= a country's government) over its citizens (= the people who live in a country) and over the economy: The ideology of etatist nationalism was prevalent during that era. During the 1950s, a compromise emerged between etatist and liberal visions of political economy based on the common goal of economic growth.
More examplesFewer examplesThese policies were in line with etatist thinking. Their “etatist” variety of liberalism was founded on the cult of the powerful state.The crisis of the etatist regime in the mid-1960s was a key factor in causing the 1967 war. He was an exponent of free enterprise, but at the same time consistently etatist in his corporatist view of the state.
